intro: Hieracium jankae, commonly known as the Janka's hawkweed, is a flowering plant species native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with ray florets and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Hieracium jankae is a perennial herb that can form dense colonies, sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
